titles.title: Providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 91) providing amounts for the expenses of certain committees of the House of Representatives in the One Hundred Fifth Congress.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-33, by Mr. Dreier.

Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 91 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The measure will be considered in the House and the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on House Oversight now printed in the resolution shall be considered as adopted. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 12.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 210 - 213 (Roll no. 67).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/19/1997--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.Res. 91 (House committee funding).
